Package pieces

Interface Piece

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public interface Piece
    Author:
    Elijah Ongoco + Brian Albert This interface lays out the basic commands that a chess piece should be able to do: move. There is an additional method that allows each piece to check if a command is legal for its type.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      char getColor()
      Getter to get the side of a piece, either 'b' or 'w'.
      boolean getFirstMove()
      Getter to get a boolean indicating if it is the pieces first move.
      int getTotalMoves()
      Get the total number of moves this piece has done.

      Setter to change whether or not a piece has moved already.
      void setTotalMoves​(int moves)
      Set the total number of moves this piece has done.
      boolean validateCommand​(Piece[][] board, java.lang.String command)
      Helper method do see if a move is valid given the current board state.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        void move​(Piece[][] board,
          java.lang.String command)
        This method gives a piece a command to move to somewhere on the board. It will run validateCommand to see whether or not the move was legal. If there is a piece sitting at the end point, it will be checked whether or not this piece can be legally captured. If so, the piece is captured and the calling piece will be placed there.
        Parameters:
        board - The board field within a Board object.
        command - The string input that signifies the command to move a piece in a certain square to another square.
        See Also:
        validateCommand(Piece[][], String)

      • validateCommand

        boolean validateCommand​(Piece[][] board,
                        java.lang.String command)
        Helper method do see if a move is valid given the current board state.
        Parameters:
        board - The board field within a Board object.
        command - The string input that signifies the command to move a piece in a certain square to another square.
        Returns:
        true or false depending on if the move is valid or not.

      • getColor

        char getColor()
        Getter to get the side of a piece, either 'b' or 'w'.
        Returns:
        'b' or 'w' depending on which side the piece belongs to

      • getFirstMove

        boolean getFirstMove()
        Getter to get a boolean indicating if it is the pieces first move.
        Returns:
        true if it is the pieces first move and false if the piece has already moved.

      • setFirstMove

        void setFirstMove​(boolean moved)
        Setter to change whether or not a piece has moved already.
        Parameters:
        moved - True or false whether or not the piece has moved

      • setTotalMoves

        void setTotalMoves​(int moves)
        Set the total number of moves this piece has done.
        Parameters:
        moves - new total number of moves.

      • getTotalMoves

        int getTotalMoves()
        Get the total number of moves this piece has done.
        Returns:
        The total number of moves done.
